title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | SB 1.17.8-9 | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | 18-02-2023
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: Om Agyanati Miran Dhasya Gyanan Janishalakaya Chaksharun Militam Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
segments.summary: The lecture begins with traditional Vaishnava prayers, invoking blessings and paying respects to the spiritual masters.

segments.key_quote: Up till now no one on earth has ever shed tears because of royal negligence.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces and explains the 8th verse of the 17th chapter of the first canto of Srimad Bhagavatam, focusing on the king's duty to protect citizens and the unprecedented nature of suffering in Parikshit Maharaj's kingdom.

segments.key_quote: is the life of the cow and the bull equally important why human life as you have heard is specially meant for God realization
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes the importance of cow protection and Brahmanical culture for spiritual advancement, highlighting the value of human life for God realization and the role of cow's milk in developing finer brain tissues.

segments.key_quote: It is simply horrible for a pure-hearted soul to see organized animal killing by the state in this age of Kali
segments.summary: The speaker discusses the government's duty to protect animals, particularly cows and bulls, and laments the organized animal killing prevalent in the age of Kali, especially in Western countries.

segments.key_quote: see Pariksit Maharaj is so sensitive because he is Krishna conscious is a pure devotee so he feels for the bull expressing its suffering condition
segments.summary: The speaker highlights Maharaj Parikshit's sensitivity and compassion towards the suffering bull, attributing it to his Krishna consciousness and pure devotion.

segments.key_quote: Krishna always wants devotees to rule Rajarishi Krishna instructed the devotees to rule Rajarishi Krishna instructed the devotees to rule Rajarishi
segments.summary: The speaker discusses the ideal of God-conscious kings (Rajarishis) and Krishna's desire for devotees to rule, referencing the Suryavamsa and Chandra Vamsa dynasties.

segments.key_quote: O son of Surabhi you need lament no longer now there is no need to fear this low class Chudra and O mother cow as long as I am living as the ruler
segments.summary: The speaker explains the 9th verse, focusing on Parikshit Maharaj's assurance of protection to the cow and bull, emphasizing the ideal of a kingdom where all are safe and cared for.

segments.key_quote: protection of bulls and cows and all other animals can be possible only when there is a state ruled by an executive head like Maharaj Pariksit
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes the importance of cow protection in state administration, highlighting Parikshit Maharaj's example and explaining the concept of Surabhi cows in the spiritual realm.

segments.key_quote: the cow and bull needs to be there in such a way that anybody even attempts to harm the cow or the bull immediately they will be killed death penalty
segments.summary: The speaker reiterates the importance of cow protection, emphasizing the nutritional value of milk and the need for strict punishment for cow killers, ultimately linking cow protection to societal peace and well-being.
